trans-unit.source: Report the specifics of a value change involving a <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref>.
This is used as a parameter in <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.OnRenderSizeChanged(System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo)"></xref> overrides.

This class parallels some of the members <xref:System.Windows.SizeChangedEventArgs> class, which is used to report event data for <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.SizeChanged>, but the two classes serve different purposes.

<xref:System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo> is specifically used for <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnRenderSizeChanged%2A> overrides, which offers class handling for an event that is not exposed as a public event in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].
For details, see <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnRenderSizeChanged%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo"></xref> class.

For the two Boolean parameters, note that you should report these as `true` only if the changes in the value are significant to rendering, or should interpret the values as such if reading existing values.
Minor changes in the size values are possible due to precision side-effects, particularly when mathematical functions are applied to the double values.
The element where the size is being changed.
The previous size, before the change.
`true` if the Width component of the size changed.
`true` if the Height component of the size changed.
Gets a value indicating whether this <xref href="System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo"></xref> reports a size change that includes a significant change to the Height component.
This property is read-only, and can only be set in the initial <xref:System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo> constructor.
`true` if there is a significant Height component change; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the new size being reported.
This property is read-only, and can only be set through the initial <xref:System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo> constructor.
The new size.
Gets the previous size of the size-related value being reported as changed.
This property is read-only, and cannot be set by any direct means, it is being reported from an actual value on some instance.
The previous size.
Gets a value that declares whether the Width component of the size changed.
This property is read-only, and can only be set through the initial <xref:System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo> constructor.
`true` if the width changed; otherwise, `false`.
